page.title: 16Waverton Parish Council
page.content: There are 11 members of the Parish Council who are elected to serve for 4 years.The Council meets in the school on the 1st Monday each month.It is responsible for running parish affairs including Street Lighting,Car Parks, Local Road Traffic,Grass cutting and public footpaths,playing fields and litter prevention.It has the power to levy a local rate,in 1985 it is 2p in the Â£.It owns Waverton Mill,an old building near the canal.The Council enters the Village for the Cheshire best Kept village competition,and is at present overseeing the new Village Green project.It is also considering purchasing the old school from the Grosvenor Estates.The building is used by various organisations including the Play Group,Cubs and Scouts,Church etc. Christleton and Rowton Villages also have their own Parish Councils
